title: In a book of 375 pages, how many total numbers of digits are used for numbering the pages? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most of the numbers have 3 digets (in the 100s place) So start with 375*3. Ok now realize every less-than-3-digit number is also included. (Numbers that are less than 100) In total there are 99 of these so subtract 99. (375*3)-99 Now realize every less-than-2-digit number is included. (Numbers less than 10) In total there are 9 of these so subtract 9 (375*3)-99–9 And there you go. If the number of pages was (random example) 4756 then the total digits would be (4756*4) -999–99–9

For first nine pages ie from1 to 9 : 9 single digits are used. For pages from 10 to 99 : 90 double digits are used. For pages from 100 to 375 : 375 - 100 + 1 = 276 triple digits are used. Total number of digits used = 9×1 + 90×2 +276×3=1035 digits .
